bibl.title: Letter from Martha Alexander to Philip Showalter Hench, April 17, 1951

div1.p: Alexander, writing on behalf of "The Journal of the History of Medicine and Allied Sciences," requests that Hench review a book on yellow fever, by George Strode, for the journal.

div1.head: Letter from Martha Alexander to Philip Showalter Hench, April 17, 1951
div1.opener:
JOURNAL OF THE HISTORY OF MEDICINE
AND ALLIED SCIENCES
Editorial Office: HISTORICAL LIBRARY, YALE UNIVERSITY SCHOOL OF MEDICINE
333 CEDAR STREET, NEW HAVEN 11, CONN.
Please reply to HENRY SCHUMAN, Inc., 20 East 70 Street, New York 21, N.Y.
April 17, 1951
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Would you care to review for the JOURNAL OF THE HISTORY OF MEDICINE AND ALLIED
SCIENCES the following work:
YELLOW FEVER, Edited by
George K. Strode. New
York - Toronto - London, McGraw-Hill Book Co, 1951.
This volume is based largely on the work carried
out by The Rockefeller Foundation and by other agen-
cies with the support and cooperation of The Rocke-
feller Foundation.

Extent and scope of the review would entirely be up to you, but we would like
to have it in a reasonable time.

Will you kindly let me know as soon as possible whether we may send you the
review copy for this purpose. Thank you.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, for JOURNAL OF THE HISTORY OF
MEDICINE AND ALLIED SCIENCES
Henry Schumann, Inc., New York
Martha Alexander ----------- Published Quarterly by HENRY SCHUMAN · 20 East 70th Street, New York 21, N. Y. ----------
